intro: Calliandra brevicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calliandra, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of bright red or pink tubular flowers. The plant is characterized by its fast growth rate and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. It is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its vibrant floral display. Additionally, it serves as a valuable source of nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
